intro: Spatularia leucanthemifolia, commonly known as the white leucanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow flowers that resemble those of the daisy. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Spatularia leucanthemifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
